newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's 1996 coffee output seen 8.0 pct lower.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's 1996 coffee output seen 8.0 pct lower.

text.p: Colombia's coffee harvest in the 1996 calendar year will be 8.0 percent lower than in 1995, the National Planning Department said.
It did not elaborate, but said Colombia's agricultural sector grew by an anemic 0.7 percent in the first half of the year, "fundamentally because of the drop in the coffee harvest."
The country's next harvest, which begins in September, is expected to be a poor one because of heavy rains during the flowering period.

Jorge Cardenas, head of the National Coffee Growers Federation, has said Colombia would likely produce 10.5 million 60-kilogram bags during the 1996 calendar year and 11.5 million bags during the 1995-1996 coffee year. Those figures are about 2.0 million bags lower than federation forecasts at the start of the year.
